entry.title: Land Shark Coffee - Lurking, Bitey, Evolutionary Light Roast
entry.summary:
Vendor: Ross Street Roasting Co.
Type: Coffee Beans
Price: 8.50 - 41.00 (10 variants)

AÂ lurking, bitey, evolutionaryÂ light roast for adventurous farmhands.

AboutÂ Land Shark Coffee

We take coffees from three different countries, roast them separately and uniquely, and then blend them together for a real kickÂ inÂ the Dickies for your cup of coffee.Â If you're driving the tractor all night trying to get the crops in (or out) or sitting at the kitchen table, Land Shark will beÂ watching...and waiting.

  • Notes: Lurking, Bitey, Evolutionary - Okay, okay: It's gonna have a fruity edge, but with a good earthiness to remind you that, yes, you're really drinking coffee
  • Coffee origins:Â Democratic Republic of Congo, Papua New Guinea, & Uganda
  • Roast level:Â Light roast

The Land Shark blend is another collaboration with Farmer Derek Klingenberg, goofball extraordinaire.Â

entry.title: Kula Peaberry - Papua New Guinea Light-Medium Roast Relationship Coffee
entry.summary:
Vendor: Ross Street Roasting Co.
Type: Coffee Beans
Price: 7.00 - 72.00 (14 variants)

Â Kula Peaberry at a glance

  • Benefits:
    • EarthyÂ note adds accessibility for "regular coffee drinkers," while also showcasingÂ bolder, fruitier notes
    • Direct Trade sourcing benefits producers, farm laborers, and their families & communities (see more below)
  • TastingÂ notes: Sweet aroma, chocolate & raisin/dried fruit notes, earthy, med-heavy body, syrupy mouthfeel
  • Roast color: Light-Medium
  • Country: Papua New Guinea
  • Region: Waghi Valley
  • Farm: Sigri Estate
  • Tree variety: Predominantly Typica
  • Elevation: 1,500-1,600 masl (5,000-5,200 ft)
  • Soil type: Volcanic
  • Harvest season: April - September
  • Current harvest:Â Arrived in USÂ Fall 2018
  • Sourcing: Benchmark Coffee Traders (Direct Trade)

Papua New Guinea is an island nation north of Australia, and positioned at the end of a string of islands coming off the southeastern tip of the Asian continent. PNGÂ has not beenÂ well-known for high-quality Specialty Coffee production,Â but our Direct Trade partner there, Benchmark Coffee Traders, recognized an opportunity toÂ produce higher-end coffees on the Sigri estate that benefit producersÂ byÂ selling into higher-end coffee markets abroad.

"Peaberry" is a word that refers to the coffee beanÂ itself - Normally, coffee cherriesÂ produce two seeds perÂ cherry.Â "Peaberries" are so-named due to a genetic mutation where only a single seed grows in the cherry, producing a smaller, rounder, denser coffee seed/bean.Â If a producer so chooses, peaberries are separated from all the "normal" seeds and sold as a lot.Â Peaberry beans display slightly different flavor characteristics from beans grown even on the same tree.

"Kula" refers to the special sorting & processing method used by Benchmark Coffee TradersÂ to ensure a high-quality flavor profile.

AboutÂ Benchmark Coffee Traders

Our Direct Trade partner in PNG, Benchmark Coffee Traders, distributes high quality green coffees from the Sigri Estate in Papua New Guinea.Â They haveÂ direct family ties with these coffee producers and work closely with them to bring their beautiful coffees to roastersÂ like us in North America.

Benchmark supports a strong social agenda that provides free housing,Â free healthcare, and free schooling to the coffee pickers and farmers who work tirelessly to helpÂ produce these unique coffees.

We are proud to be partnering with Benchmark for the first time in 2018, and look forward to a fruitful relationship in the future!

Â

entry.title: The Front 40 - Contemporary Fruit-Forward Roast for Espresso
entry.summary:
Vendor: Ross Street Roasting Co.
Type: Coffee Beans
Price: 15.00 - 65.00 (12 variants)

The Front 40 exhibits a more contemporary (and lighter) roast profile for espresso to highlight fruit notes first, but still maintain enough nuttiness/chocolate for the shot to stand up in milk drinks. Despite what we call a "light-medium" roast color, this roast employs longer development times to even out the consistency of the blend and boost body & sweetness in the cup.

The Front 40 at a glance

  • Notes: Tangy fruit, nutty, sweet, medium body
  • 100%Â Relationship Coffee components
    • 50% Papua New Guinea coffee from the Sigri Estate in the Waghi Valley region, farm of our Relationship CoffeeÂ partner, Benchmark Coffee Traders
    • 50% Brazil coffee from the Seibt Family Farm,Â Cerrado Mineiro region, Minas Gerais state, SE Brazil
    • Relationship Coffees are close sourcing partnershipsÂ with coffee producers, helping ensure high-quality coffee and equitable pay for coffee laborers (See all Relationship Coffees)

entry.title: Oil Derek - Farmer Derek's Extra Dark Roast Coffee Blend
entry.summary:
Vendor: Ross Street Roasting Co.
Type: Coffee Beans
Price: 7.00 - 65.00 (14 variants)

An oily dark roast for cowpokes. Perfect for cowboy coffee by the campfire, or long nights in the tractor during harvest season.

About Oil Derek

Legend has it that cattle rancher and goofball YouTuber, Farmer Derek Klingenberg, was named after the oil derricks that can be seen across his native south central Kansas. So for our first forray intoÂ extra dark roast territory, we thought it fitting to play on words a bit with our friend's name.Â 

  • Coffee origins: Nicaragua & Papua New Guinea (sourced directly)
  • Roast level: Extra Dark / French Roast - Beans haveÂ oils plainly visibleÂ  on their surface
  • Tasting notes: SmokyÂ & rustic - Burnt tumbleweed, Tractor tire, Saddle leather

Farmer Derek Klingenberg

Derek's family has beenÂ ranching and farming in south-central Kansas for a century.Â About 10 years ago, Derek discovered that he had a talent for making ridiculous farming videos and song parodies and putting them on YouTube. More recently he's become a drone/cow artist and regularly serenades his cattle with his trombone. Some of Derek'sÂ videos have gone viral and his top videos have overÂ 30 million combined views.

We became friends with the Klingenberg family just over a decade ago when Roaster Brian met Derek's younger brother at seminary in Virginia. After graduation, Derek's brother became a pastor but Plain Ol' Brian went on to become Roaster Brian, founder of Ross Street Roasting. This new Farmer Derek coffee is a product of our decade-longÂ relationship that's morphed into a great business partnership.

entry.title: Divine Inspiration - Nicaraguan Light-Medium Roast Relationship Coffee
entry.summary:
Vendor: Ross Street Roasting Co.
Type: Coffee Beans
Price: 6.00 - 73.00 (14 variants)

2020-21Â Crop Now Available!

Divine Inspiration is a coffee produced byÂ aÂ community of coffee growers in the Jinotega region of Nicaragua. We have sourced coffee for Divine Inspiration from producers in Matagalpa & Jinotega since our founding in 2015, and have made multiple visits to partner-farmer families to see firsthand the level of careÂ they put into growing this delicious coffee.

On our January 2019 origin visit, YouTuberÂ Farmer Derek KlingenbergÂ came with us and produced this amazing video.Â And Divine Inspiration is his favorite coffee!

This is "relationship coffee" at its best, and we've come to know and love theÂ partner-farmers of Divine Inspiration.Â As the harvest years progress and ourÂ coffee purchasesÂ from Gold Mountain Coffee Growers expand,Â our relationshipÂ continues toÂ become a thing of "Divine Inspiration."

Divine Inspiration at a glance

  • Flavor notes:Â Chocolate,Â spicedÂ apple, nutty
  • Roast level:Â Light-Medium
  • Benefits: DirectÂ relationship coffee with a single coffee-growing community, supported by periodic fundraising for communityÂ and economic development
  • Recommended brewing method: Drip coffee, Espresso
  • Origin: Nicaragua,Â JinotegaÂ region
  • Farms: Multiple smallholder farmsÂ in the region
  • Processing method: Washed
  • Harvest season: December - March
  • Current harvest: 2020-21, Arrived in US Sept 2020
  • Sourcing: Gold Mountain Coffee Growers (Direct Trade)

About Gold Mountain Coffee Growers

Gold Mountain Coffee Growers is a direct trade social enterprise that connects farmers of high-cupping specialty coffee with coffee roasters.Â They haveÂ their own coffee farm (Finca Idealista) in NicaraguaÂ and export coffee themselves to their North American warehouse.

Gold MountainÂ treatsÂ its own farm and partner producersâ farms like fine wine vineyards to maintain a thriving social enterpriseÂ and ensure the highest cup quality. They employÂ a ripeness team during harvest season,Â equipped with refractometers and special ripeness wristbands, supervising pickersâ baskets for maximum ripeness of coffee cherries. The result is excellent-cupping coffee.

Gold MountainÂ partner farmers receive microcredit and larger loans as well as technical assistance. With this empowerment, they increase yields, expand their farms, invest in processing equipment, and provide for their families. TheyÂ work with communities on projects including running water and libraries in schools and electricity in homes. They recentlyÂ bought a section of rainforest adjacent to their own farm to protect endangered species there.Â These and more projects are sustained through excellent-cupping specialty coffee.

Gold Mountain CoffeeÂ GrowersÂ were the winner of the 2016 Sustainability Award from the Specialty Coffee Association of Europe (now the SCA)

Photo credits:Â Gold Mountain Coffee Growers/@goldmtncoffee (Instagram,Â Twitter,Â Facebook)Â

entry.title: Roaster Brian's Curated Coffee Playlist (Subscription)
entry.summary:
Vendor: Ross Street Roasting Co.
Type: Coffee Beans
Price: 14.40 - 68.95 (12 variants)

If youÂ love adventure, this is the subscription for you!Â Roaster Brian willÂ select a different Single Origin orÂ Blended coffeeÂ each month and deliver itÂ straight to your door.

Benefits of Roaster Brian's Curated Coffee Playlist

  • New Single Origin coffees every month from aÂ rotating cast of the world's coffee producing countries
  • 10%Â OFF retail price just for signing up
  • Roast profiles of Light to Light-Medium to accentuate the vast diversity of flavorsÂ present inÂ mid- to high-grade Speciality Coffees
  • Subscription re-ordersÂ bank points in RossRewards
  • Access to occasional high-end, award-winningÂ micro-lots at significant discount
  • Roaster Brian sometimes throws other goodies inÂ the shipping box! :)Â 

How Much Coffee Does a Bag Make?

When buying coffee on subscriptionÂ it's sometimes hard toÂ gauge at the outset how much coffee you'll need, and how often you'llÂ need it. So we've developed this handy guide to help you figure that out before you buy!

We're making a few assumptions here, so let's just tell you what those are. ThisÂ guide assumes that...

  • A 1:17 ratio of coffee to water (achievable with the use of a scale)
  • A mug size of 10oz
  • Each person is only drinking 1 cup / day

"Too much math, gaaaaaah!"

Don't sweat it, Roaster Brian isn't the best at math, either. The great thing about ourÂ Coffee Subscription system is that it putsÂ you in the drivers seat. Didn't get enough coffee? Move up your next delivery date! Got too much coffee? Bump back your next delivery date! - Easy. And no need to doÂ any math (unless you really want to, and that's cool).

entry.title: Meow That's What I Call Light Roast! - RAYGUN collaboration, Light Roast Coffee Blend
entry.summary:
Vendor: Ross Street Roasting Co.
Type: Coffee Beans
Price: 7.00 - 65.00 (14 variants)

A new generation of coffeeÂ roasters and coffee lovers are discovering the wide diversity of flavorsÂ possible in coffeesÂ roasted on the lighter end of the roast color spectrum. Fruit notes emerge that can be tart, sweet, or somewhere in between. Light roasts can exhibit light body up to medium or even heavy bodies, depending on the bean itself and the roaster. And when lighter roasted coffeesÂ are blended together,Â the flavor partyÂ really gets going!

"Meow That's What I Call Light Roast!" takes two different bright, fruity Ethiopian coffees and bringsÂ in between them aÂ Colombian component with darker fruit notes and heavier body - creating a sweet,Â fruity, substantial, easy-drinking light roast blend.

"Meow That's What I Call Light Roast!" is a collaboration between us here at RSR and Iowa apparel legends, RAYGUN.Â RAYGUN sells this coffee at their 4 retail locations in Iowa and Kansas City.

"Meow That's What I Call Light Roast!" at a glance

  • Benefits: Taste the rainbow of light roast flavors with Gary, a raygun-weidling cat!
  • Tasting notes:Â Bright fruits, ripe pie cherry, subtle chocolate,Â sweet, light-medium body
  • BrewingÂ suggestions: Pour-over orÂ Drip coffee makers
  • Components
    • 45% Ethiopia Yirgacheffe, Washed Grade 2
    • 30% Colombia, Huila regional best lot
    • 25% Ethiopia Yirgacheffe, Natural Grade 2
    • All components of this blend are sourced through our importing partner, Cafe Imports, Minneapolis, MN

Read more about the fun & collaborativeÂ product development story for this coffee: Ross Street & Raygun: A prrrrrrfect pairing.

entry.title: Bohemian Gothic - Dark Roast Coffee Blend
entry.summary:
Vendor: Ross Street Roasting Co.
Type: Coffee Beans
Price: 7.00 - 65.00 (14 variants)

Dark roast lovers, rejoice: Bohemian Gothic gives you the smokiness and "bold flavor" you love, without the acrid bitterness that is all too common in dark roasts.Â You'll have a smooth, smokey experience.Â Bohemian Gothic isÂ a blend of Direct Trade coffees from Nicaragua & Papua New Guinea (see more below).

The name "Bohemian Gothic" is a nod to the Czech immigrant heritage in this part of Iowa,Â which was also the home region to renowned American painter, Grant Wood, whose painting "American Gothic" isÂ a cultural IconÂ known the world over.

Bohemian Gothic at a glance

  • Benefits:Â Smokey without being bitter, 100%Â Relationship Coffee sourcing (see below)
  • Flavor notes: Smokey, Chocolatey, Medium body
  • 100%Â Relationship Coffee components
    • 50% Papua New Guinea coffee from the Sigri Estate in the Waghi Valley region, farm of our Relationship CoffeeÂ partner, Benchmark Coffee Traders
    • 50% Brazil coffee from the Seibt Family Farm,Â Cerrado Mineiro region, Minas Gerais state, SE Brazil
    • Relationship Coffees are close sourcing partnershipsÂ with coffee producers, helping ensure high-quality coffee and equitable pay for coffee laborers (See all Relationship Coffees)

Bohemian Gothic is also our standardÂ roast for cold brew, used in-shop at our roastery and also by Brewhemia inÂ our cold brew collaboration, available atÂ Brewhemia and New Pioneer Food Co-Op in Cedar Rapids, Iowa.

entry.title: Jack's Feed Store - Medium Roast Coffee Blend
entry.summary:
Vendor: Ross Street Roasting Co.
Type: Coffee Beans
Price: 7.00 - 65.00 (14 variants)

If the words "fruity" or "smoky" make you nervous when reading coffee tasting notes, and you just want "a real cup of coffee" withÂ good, solid flavor - Jack's Feed Store isÂ for you. Or maybe you're taking coffeeÂ to a family gathering and need to satisfy the greatest number of coffee drinkers' tastes. Jack's is yourÂ crowd-pleaser coffee, no question.

Jack's Feed Store is named after the farm animal feed, grain milling, and farm supply store that used to operate out of ourÂ roast production facilityÂ in small town Tama, Iowa.Â A throwbackÂ name that honors the past and perfectly matches the rugged, workmanlike nature of the coffee in your hand. Make Jack's a part of your morning ritual.

Jack's Feed Store at a glance

  • Benefits: Easy drinking, crowd pleaser, robust flavors, 100% Relationship Coffee sourcing (see below)
  • Flavor notes:Â Chocolate and subtle fruit notesÂ and an earthy, rustic quality, complex, mediumÂ body
  • 100%Â Relationshiop CoffeeÂ components
    • 60% Papua New Guinea coffee from the Sigri Estate in the Waghi Valley region, farm of our Relationship CoffeeÂ partner, Benchmark Coffee Traders
    • 40% Brazil coffee from the Seibt Family Farm,Â Cerrado Mineiro region, Minas Gerais state, SE Brazil
    • Relationship Coffees are close sourcing partnershipsÂ with coffee producers, helping ensure high-quality coffee and equitable pay for coffee laborers (See all Relationship Coffees)

The former owner of Jack's Feed Store is still living just up the street from his old place of business. During the warmer months,Â Jack drops into his old shop to chat with Roaster Brian on his way down to the Iowa River to fish. Plot twist: Jack is not a coffee drinker!!
